sen.j: 野村萬斎（のむら まんさい）は、狂言和泉流野村万蔵家の名跡で、当代は二世。
sen.e: Mansai NOMURA is a family name of Manzo (万蔵)NOMURA family of Izumi-ryu (Izumi-school) Kyogen (Japanese traditional farce) and the present head of the family is the second generation.
sen.cmt: 「狂言和泉流」は'Izumi school of farce played during a No play cycle'となっていますが、これだとNo(能）の説明がいりますので、「狂言」を'Japanese traditional farce'としました。またManzo（万蔵）につきましては、下に「万造」が出てきますので、漢字を入れました。
sen.e: Mansai NOMURA is a successional family name of the Manzo (万蔵)NOMURA family of Izumi-ryu (Izumi-school) Kyogen (Japanese traditional farce) and the present head of the family is the second generation.
sen.cmt: 「名跡」を a family name からa successional family name に変更、Manzo (万蔵）NOMURA familyに定冠詞theを付与。
sen.e: Mansai NOMURA is a successional family name of the Manzo (万蔵)NOMURA family of Izumi-ryu (Izumi-school) Kyogen (Japanese traditional farce) and the present head of the family is the second generation.

sen.j: 初世野村萬斎
sen.e: Mansai NOMURA, the first
Mansai NOMURA, the first
Mansai NOMURA, the first

sen.j: 初世野村萬斎（1862年（文久2）7月21日 -1938年（昭和13）1月14日）は加賀藩の狂言役者であった野村万蔵家の五世。
sen.e: Mansai NOMURA, the first (August 16, 1862 – January 14, 1938) was the fifth generation of the Manzo NOMURA family who had been served as Kyogen actors of the Kaga Domain.
sen.cmt: （表記の変更） 「狂言役者」は'Kyogen yakusha (actor of farce played during a No play cycle)'となっていますが、上にあわせてKyogen actorとしました。
sen.e: Mansai NOMURA, the first (August 16, 1862 – January 14, 1938) was the fifth generation of the Manzo NOMURA family who had served as Kyogen actors of the Kaga Domain.
sen.cmt: who had been served as -->who had served as
sen.e: Mansai NOMURA, the first (August 16, 1862 – January 14, 1938) was the fifth generation of the Manzo NOMURA family who had served as Kyogen actors of the Kaga Domain.

sen.j: 前名万造。
sen.e: His former name was Manzo (万造).
sen.cmt: 「万蔵」と「万造」の発音が同じなので、漢字を入れました。
sen.e: His former name was Manzo (万造).
His former name was Manzo (万造).

sen.j: 1883年（明治16）に東京へ移住。
sen.e: In 1883 Mansai moved to Tokyo.
In 1883 Mansai moved to Tokyo.
In 1883 Mansai moved to Tokyo.

sen.j: 1922年（大正11）、家督を長男万作（野村万蔵 (6世)）に譲り、隠居名・萬斎を名乗る。
sen.e: In 1922 he handed over the reigns of the family to his oldest son Mansaku (Manzo NOMURA, the sixth), and used his name after retirement, Mansai.
In 1922 he handed over the reigns of the family to his oldest son Mansaku (Manzo NOMURA, the sixth), and called himself Mansai, a name after his retirement.
In 1922 he handed over the reigns of the family to his oldest son Mansaku (Manzo NOMURA, the sixth), and called himself Mansai, a name after his retirement.

sen.j: 次男万介は師家を継いで、九世三宅藤九郎となる。
sen.e: His second son Mansuke succeeded to Shike (Training Master's credentials) and became Tokuro MIYAKE, the ninth.
His second son Mansuke succeeded to Shike (Training Master's credentials) and became Tokuro MIYAKE, the ninth.
His second son Mansuke succeeded to Shike (Training Master's credentials) and became Tokuro MIYAKE, the ninth.

sen.j: , 東京都
sen.e: Tokyo
Tokyo

sen.j: 二世野村萬斎（1966年4月5日 -）は東京都生まれ。
sen.e: Mansai NOMURA, the second (April 5, 1966 -) was born in Tokyo.
Mansai NOMURA, the second (April 5, 1966 -) was born in Tokyo.
Mansai NOMURA, the second (April 5, 1966 -) was born in Tokyo.

sen.j: 狂言師野村万作、詩人阪本若葉子の長男。
sen.e: The oldest son between Mansaku NOMURA, a Kyogen performer, and Wakabako SAKAMOTO, a poet
The oldest son between Mansaku NOMURA, a Kyogen performer, and Wakabako SAKAMOTO, a poet

sen.j: 本名は野村武司。
sen.e: His real name is Takeshi NOMURA.
His real name is Takeshi NOMURA.
His real name is Takeshi NOMURA.

sen.j: 筑波大学附属高等学校、東京藝術大学音楽学部邦楽科能楽専攻卒。
sen.e: He graduated from the High School attached to Tsukuba University, and the course of Noh play, Department of Traditional Japanese Music, Faculty of Music, Tokyo National University of Fine Arts & Music.

He graduated from the High School attached to Tsukuba University, and the course of Noh play, Department of Traditional Japanese Music, Faculty of Music, Tokyo National University of Fine Arts & Music.

sen.j: 長男は野村裕基。
sen.e: His oldest son is Yuki NOMURA.
His oldest son is Yuki NOMURA.
His oldest son is Yuki NOMURA.

sen.j: 野村萬（本名：太良）と野村万作（本名：二朗）の兄弟は、野村万蔵六世野村万蔵（万造 万作）の息子だが、六世の死後、名跡を分配することになり、兄・萬が野村万蔵 (7世)を襲名し、弟・万作は五世万造（六世万蔵の父）の隠居名・萬斎を相続することになった。
sen.e: Although the brothers of Man NOMURA (his real name is Taro) and Mansaku NOMURA (his real name is Jiro) are sons of Manzo (万蔵)NOMURA, or Manzo NOMURA, the sixth (his former names were Manzo万造 and Mansaku), after the sixth's death, they decided to divide their family name - Man, the older brother, would succeed to a professional name of Manzo NOMURA, the seventh, and Mansaku, the younger brother, would inherit Mansai, a name after retirement of Manzo, the fifth (father of Manzo, the sixth).
sen.cmt: 「野村万蔵六世野村万蔵（万造 万作）」ここがわかりにくいです。「野村万蔵六世」である、「野村万蔵」と解釈しました。括弧内は野村万蔵の前名２個としました。
sen.e: The brothers of Man NOMURA (his real name is Taro) and Mansaku NOMURA (his real name is Jiro) are sons of Manzo (万蔵)NOMURA, or Manzo NOMURA, the sixth (his former names were Manzo万造 and Mansaku万作); after the sixth's death, they decided to divide their family name, that is, Man, the older brother, would succeed to a professional name of Manzo NOMURA, the seventh, and Mansaku, the younger brother, would inherit Mansai, the name after retirement of Manzo, the fifth (the father of Manzo, the sixth).
sen.cmt: 漢字の「万作」を追記、その他表現の変更。
sen.e: The brothers of Man NOMURA (his real name is Taro) and Mansaku NOMURA (his real name is Jiro) are sons of Manzo (万蔵)NOMURA, or Manzo NOMURA, the sixth (his former names were Manzo万造 and Mansaku万作); after the sixth's death, they decided to divide their family name, that is, Man, the older brother, would succeed to a professional name of Manzo NOMURA, the seventh, and Mansaku, the younger brother, would inherit Mansai, the name after retirement of Manzo, the fifth (the father of Manzo, the sixth).

sen.j: しかし、万作は「万作」という名に愛着を持っていた為に「萬斎」を自分では名乗らず、この名前を名乗ることを希望した長男に譲ったものである。
sen.e: However, Mansaku did not use 'Mansai' himself because he was attached to the name 'Mansaku' and gave Mansai to his oldest son who wished to use it.
However, Mansaku did not use 'Mansai' himself because he was attached to the name 'Mansaku' and gave Mansai to his oldest son who wished to use it.
However, Mansaku did not use 'Mansai' himself because he was attached to the name 'Mansaku' and gave Mansai to his oldest son who wished to use it.

sen.j: 父の兄弟には萬の他に、野村四郎（観世流シテ方）、野村万之介（狂言方）がいる。
sen.e: Other than Man, his father's brothers include Shiro NOMURA (Kanze-ryu shite kata (main roles of the Kanze school) and Mannosuke NOMURA (kyogen kata (comic actors)).
Other than Man, his father's brothers include Shiro NOMURA (Kanze-ryu shite kata (main roles of the Kanze school) and Mannosuke NOMURA (kyogen kata (comic actors)).
Other than Man, his father's brothers include Shiro NOMURA (Kanze-ryu shite kata (main roles of the Kanze school) and Mannosuke NOMURA (kyogen kata (comic actors)).

sen.j: いとこに、野村万蔵 (9世)及び万蔵家の分家である万禄家を50年ぶりに復興した福岡在の野村万禄（本名：吉積史高）がいる。
sen.e: His cousins include Manzo NOMURA (the ninth) and Manroku NOMURA (his real name: Fumitaka YOSHIZUMI) who lives in Fukuoka Prefecture and revived the Manroku family, a branch family of the Manzo family, for the first time in 50 years.

His cousins include Manzo NOMURA (the ninth) and Manroku NOMURA (his real name: Fumitaka YOSHIZUMI) who lives in Fukuoka Prefecture and revived the Manroku family, a branch family of the Manzo family, for the first time in 50 years.

His cousins include Manzo NOMURA (the ninth) and Manroku NOMURA (his real name: Fumitaka YOSHIZUMI) who lives in Fukuoka Prefecture and revived the Manroku family, a branch family of the Manzo family, for the first time in 50 years.

sen.j: 狂言以外でも一般の俳優としてドラマ、映画、舞台などで多くの活動を行っており、端正な容姿と気品ある物腰、独特の発声等で存在感を示す。
sen.e: Apart from Kyogen, Mansai is engaged in many activities such as dramas, movies and stages as an ordinary actor, and shows his presence with his nice looks and graceful manners and unique vocalization, and so on.

Apart from Kyogen, Mansai is engaged in many activities such as dramas, movies and stages as an ordinary actor, and shows his presence with features such as nice looks, graceful manners and unique vocalization.

Apart from Kyogen, Mansai is engaged in many activities such as dramas, movies and stages as an ordinary actor, and shows his presence with features such as nice looks, graceful manners and unique vocalization.

sen.j: 1994年に出演した大河ドラマ『花の乱』や1997年の連続テレビ小説『あぐり』での好演で、その名が広く知られるようになった。
sen.e: His fame became widely known for his excellent performances in the Taiga Dorama (NHK TV Historical Drama) "Hana no Ran" (Turmoil of Flowers) where he appeared in 1994 and in the TV serial story "Aguri" (a woman's name) in 1997.
sen.cmt: NHKだけではテレビということが日本以外の人にはわからないと思われますので、'NHK TV'としました。また「連続テレビ小説」は‘NHK Asadora Drama’とありますが、Asadoraではわからないと思い、「連続小説」の意味の'serial story'としました。
sen.e: His name became widely known for his excellent performances in the Taiga Drama (NHK TV Historical Drama) "Hana no Ran" (Turmoil of Flowers) in 1994 and in the TV serial story "Aguri" (a woman's name) in 1997.
sen.cmt: fame をname に変更、Taiga Dorama を Taiga Drama に変更（スペルミス修正）、その他表現の見直し。
sen.e: His name became widely known for his excellent performances in the Taiga Drama (NHK TV Historical Drama) "Hana no Ran" (Turmoil of Flowers) in 1994 and in the TV serial story "Aguri" (a woman's name) in 1997.

sen.j: また著作や舞台イベントなどで狂言の普及に努める傍ら、日本伝統芸能と現代劇との融合を目指して『藪の中』や『RASHOMON』、『敦 - 山月記・名人伝 -』などを演出し、多大な評価を得ている。
sen.e: While he has devoted to promotion of Kyogen in his books and stage events, aiming at fusion of Japanese traditional arts and contemporary dramas at the same time, he directed "Yabu no naka" (In the Bush), "RASHOMON" (Rasho-mon Gate) and "Atsushi Sangetsuki Meijinden" (The life of a master of the memoirs of the moon over the mountain) and has gained high evaluation for that.

Along with promotion of Kyogen in his books and stage events, he directed "Yabu no naka" (In the Bush), "RASHOMON" (Rasho-mon Gate), "Atsushi Sangetsuki Meijinden" (The life of a master of the memoirs of the moon over the mountain) and so on, aiming at fusion of Japanese traditional arts and contemporary dramas, and has gained high evaluation for that.

Along with promotion of Kyogen in his books and stage events, he directed "Yabu no naka" (In the Bush), "RASHOMON" (Rasho-mon Gate), "Atsushi Sangetsuki Meijinden" (The life of a master of the memoirs of the moon over the mountain) and so on, aiming at fusion of Japanese traditional arts and contemporary dramas, and has gained high evaluation for that.

sen.j: 重要無形文化財総合指定。
sen.e: He was designated as the general holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property.

sen.j: 1999年 『子午線の祀り』で、新中納言知盛役
sen.e: In 1999 appeared as Shin-Chunagon (New Vice Counselor of State) Tomomori (TAIRA no Tomomori) in "Shigosen no Matsuri" (The Rite of the Meridian).
sen.cmt: この「新中納言知盛」は「平知盛」のことで、「新中納言」と呼ばれたとあります。「新中納言」が固有名詞になっているため大文字にしました。また、「知盛」が誰を指すのかわかるように、「平知盛」を付け加えました。：http://www.kabuki-bito.jp/kabuki_column/todaysword/post_153.html

sen.j: 『国盗人』演出・主演
sen.e: Directed and starred in "Kuni Nusubito" (Thief of a Nation).
Directed and starred in "Kuni Nusubito" (Thief of a Nation).
Directed and starred in "Kuni Nusubito" (Thief of a Nation).

sen.j: 2008年 NHKドラマ『鞍馬天狗 (小説)』で主演、鞍馬天狗役。
sen.e: In 2008 starred in the NHK drama "Kurama Tengu" (an imaginary hero in Japanese period dramas and novels. He wore a mask of tengu, a long-nosed goblin, which was believed to live in Mt. Kurama) (novel), appearing as Kurama Tengu.
sen.cmt: 「鞍馬天狗」については、下のウェブサイトなどを参照して説明を作りました。：http://kotobank.jp/word/%E9%9E%8D%E9%A6%AC%E5%A4%A9%E7%8B%97
sen.e: In 2008 starred in the NHK drama "Kurama Tengu" (an imaginary hero in Japanese period dramas and novels. He wore a mask of tengu, a long-nosed goblin, which was believed to live in Mt. Kurama) (novel), appearing as Kurama Tengu.

In 2008 starred in the NHK drama "Kurama Tengu" (an imaginary hero in Japanese period dramas and novels. He wore a mask of tengu, a long-nosed goblin, which was believed to live in Mt. Kurama) (novel), appearing as Kurama Tengu.

sen.j: 『わが魂は輝く水なり』で主演、斎藤実盛役。
sen.e: Starred in "Waga Tamashii ha Kagayaku Mizu Nari" (My Spirit is Shining Water), appearing as Sanemori SAITO.
Starred in "Waga Tamashii ha Kagayaku Mizu Nari" (My Spirit is Shining Water), appearing as Sanemori SAITO.
Starred in "Waga Tamashii ha Kagayaku Mizu Nari" (My Spirit is Shining Water), appearing as Sanemori SAITO.

sen.j: 東京大学教養学部非常勤講師。
sen.e: A part-time lecturer at Faculty of Liberal Arts, University of Tokyo.
A part-time lecturer at Faculty of Liberal Arts, University of Tokyo.
A part-time lecturer at Faculty of Liberal Arts, University of Tokyo.

sen.j: 2008年 『あの戦争は何だったのか 日米開戦と東条英機』、TBSテレビ、昭和天皇役
sen.e: In 2008 appeared as Emperor Showa (Hirohito) in the TBS TV "Ano Senso wa Nan Datta no ka, Nichibei Kaisen to Tojo Hideki" (What was that war? Outbreak of the war between Japan and the United States, and Hideki TOJO).
sen.cmt: 外国ではEmperor Hirohitoで有名ですので、括弧をして付け加えました。
sen.e: In 2008 appeared as Emperor Showa (Hirohito) in the TBS TV "Ano Senso wa Nan Datta no ka, Nichibei Kaisen to Tojo Hideki" (What was that war? Outbreak of the war between Japan and the United States, and Hideki TOJO).

In 2008 appeared as Emperor Showa (Hirohito) in the TBS TV "Ano Senso wa Nan Datta no ka, Nichibei Kaisen to Tojo Hideki" (What was that war? Outbreak of the war between Japan and the United States, and Hideki TOJO).
